title: Drawing, "Design for Stage Curtain: Apollo and Marsyas, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza", 1800–01
title_raw: Design for Stage Curtain: Apollo and Marsyas, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Horizontal rectangle. Curtains frame scene, stage frame shown. Middle-ground shown sitting at foot of enormous tree, in center Marsyas and Apollo plays flute.  Muse character (?) holds wreath over head. At right, Listerners shown behind main audience at left in foreground. Middleground, at left Dionysos with procession. Caption written in ink over graphite: "Teatro della V musica."

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Stage Curtain: Apollo and Marsyas, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza", 1800–01. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3180.
